publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5409 Donald Gorrie: Scots Language Dictionaries—That the Parliament recognises the long history of Scots language dictionaries, from Jamieson’s in 1808 to the 10-volume Scottish National Dictionary completed in 1976, the Dictionary of the Older Scots Tongue completed in 12 volumes in 2002 and the online Dictionary of the Scots Language in 2004, which together put Scotland at the forefront of producers of dictionaries of minority languages; also welcomes the work being done on Faclair na Gàidhlig, and, in order to safeguard the future of these long-term dictionary projects, urges the Scottish Executive and other government, commercial and charitable organisations to co-operate in providing the requisite funds for continuing work on them.

S2M-5409 Scots Language Dictionaries (lodged on 12 January 2007) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Nora Radcliffe*, Ms Sandra White*, Rob Gibson*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Murray Tosh*, Stewart Stevenson*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Brian Adam*, Robin Harper*, Jackie Baillie*, Carolyn Leckie*, John Swinburne*
S2M-5409 Scots Language Dictionaries (lodged on 12 January 2007) Chris Ballance* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-5409 Scots Language Dictionaries (lodged on 12 January 2007) Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-5409 Scots Language Dictionaries (lodged on 12 January 2007) Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-5409 Scots Language Dictionaries (lodged on 12 January 2007) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-5409 Scots Language Dictionaries (lodged on 12 January 2007) Linda Fabiani*

S2M-5409 Donald Gorrie: Scots Language Dictionaries—That the Parliament recognises the long history of Scots language dictionaries, from Jamieson’s in 1808 to the 10-volume Scottish National Dictionary completed in 1976, the Dictionary of the Older Scots Tongue completed in 12 volumes in 2002 and the online Dictionary of the Scots Language in 2004, which together put Scotland at the forefront of producers of dictionaries of minority languages; also welcomes the work being done on Faclair na Gàidhlig, and, in order to safeguard the future of these long-term dictionary projects, urges the Scottish Executive and other government, commercial and charitable organisations to co-operate in providing the requisite funds for continuing work on them. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Rob Gibson, Mr Jamie Stone, Murray Tosh, Stewart Stevenson, Mr Andrew Welsh, Brian Adam, Robin Harper, Jackie Baillie, Carolyn Leckie, John Swinburne, Chris Ballance, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Rosie Kane, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Dr Jean Turner, Linda Fabiani
